People in close contact with patients or with those suspected of 2019-nCoV infection should be examined immediately if they experience respiratory symptoms, such as fever, or related symptoms. Even if their test result is negative, they should be temporarily isolated at home for 14 days after the last contact with confirmed patients—since 14 days is the disease maximum incubation period.
16 The National Health Commission also recommends that members of the public should wash their hands with soap and water for at least 20 seconds and, when going outside, wear a medical face mask and cover their nose and mouth with a tissue, arm, or hand when coughing or sneezing.
